author: courier-journal.com
text: Portland’s weather forecast for both Saturday and Sunday calls for highs near 77 degrees and sunny skies. High clouds kept Friday’s high temperatures below forecast but the National Weather Service expects clouds to disperse Saturday to allow temperatures “to warm to around 5-10 degrees warmer than yesterday’s temperatures, in the mid to upper 70s across the inland valleys and mid to upper 60s along the coast.” Sunday’s forecast is similar but high clouds may not clear for sunny skies until late morning. It’s a perfect weekend to visit a [pumpkin patch, ](https://www.oregonlive.com/weather/2024/09/when-do-portland-area-pumpkin-patches-open.html)go for [a hike](https://www.oregonlive.com/travel/2024/10/beautiful-fall-hikes-close-to-portland-that-you-should-be-checking-out-right-now.html), explore the [Oregon coast](https://www.oregonlive.com/travel/2024/10/old-meets-new-as-changes-enliven-newports-bayfront.html) or visit [a farmers market.](https://pdxparent.com/farmers-markets-portland-oregon/) Or maybe even for [a football game.](https://www.oregonlive.com/ducks/2024/10/what-time-tv-channel-is-oregon-football-vs-ohio-state-today-spread-game-odds-how-to-watch-streaming-free.html)
